titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Executive Officer Subject Files, Verne S. Atwater
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Executive Officer Subject Files, Verne S. Atwater FA1351
titlestmt.author: Katie Martin

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-01 03:23:46 -0500.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Executive Officer Subject Files, Verne S. Atwater

physdesc.extent: 18 boxes - 16 letter document containers, 1 legal document box, and 1 half-letter document container

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into two series: 1. Subject Files, 1964-1969; 2. Information Systems Technical Documents, 1965-1968

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Ford Foundation in 2017 and ingested by RAC as Accessions 2017:076 and 2017:086.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of the Executive Officer Subject Files of Verne S. Atwater, including correspondence, reports, financial statements, and meeting minutes related to the Ford Foundation's administrative activities, organizational structure, and new building project. The collection also houses reports and correspondence concerning the Satellite Project, a Ford Foundation initiative to build a satellite to broadcast educational television programs.
The collection also contains technical memoranda, notes, and reports regarding the improvement of the Ford Foundation's information system from 1966 to 1968.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Dr. Verne S. Atwater joined the Ford Foundation as the first director of administration in 1956, and held several positions in his 12 years with the Foundation. In 1962, he became the representative for Argentina and Chile in Buenos Aires and then was promoted to director of the Latin America and Caribbean program. He was elected vice president in 1966, and he held administrative responsibility for the construction of the Ford Foundation's new headquarters building. When the building was completed in 1968, Atwater returned to his career in education and finance. He is a co-author of the book A Memoir of The Ford Foundation: The Early Years, 1936-1938.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.
